In this graph, the height of the root node (h) is 1, and the number of edges in the longest path from root node to any leaf node is 7.

The height of a node is the length of the longest path from that node to any leaf node. The number of edges in the longest path is equal to the sum of the heights of the nodes on that path.

In this case, the longest path from h to any leaf node is from h to yb, which has 7 edges. Therefore, the height of the root node h is 1, and the height of any leaf node is 0 (as mentioned in the question).

In other words, there are 7 nodes (jb, db, etc.) along the longest path, which explains the 7 edges. Therefore, this graph has 8 nodes (including the root node h) and 15 edges.
